Top-3 Scripts:
so_14492590: #!/bin/bash
declare -a arr
while read -r line; do
    arr=(${line//,/ })
    printf "Rank\t: %s\nName\t: %s\nSchool\t: %s\nMajor\t: %s\nYear\t: %s\n" ${arr[@]}
done < file.csv

ul_404699: jq -c 'select ...' file.json > out.json
printf '{"nt":%i}\n' `wc -l < out.json` >> out.json

so_57689809: jq -r '"-o /dev/null\nurl = \(.[].url)"' file |
curl -sSLK- -w'%{url_effective}\n' |
jq -R 'fromjson | map(. + {redirection: input})' file -

Explanations about Options.-s:
Silent or quiet mode. Don't show progress meter or error messages. Makes Curl
 mute. It will still output the data you ask for, potentially even to the
 terminal/stdout unless you redirect it.
